metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5407 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Using SVG filters that don't use the fixed point math implementation on a target iframe, a malicious page can extract pixel values from a targeted user. This can be used to extract history information and read text values across domains. This violates same-origin policy and leads to information disclosure. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 52, Firefox ESR < 45.8, Thunderbird < 52, and Thunderbird < 45.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5407` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 52.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
